Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Activity
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Course
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict, java.lang.Comparable<Course>
    public class Course
extends Activity
implements java.lang.Comparable<Course>
    A course on a scheduling system. Course.java maintains information about a course such as the name, section, title, instructor ID, credits and meeting time. Allows the user to create a course with specified fields. User can return all field methods.
    Author:
    Ashten Herr

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Course​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String section, int credits, java.lang.String instructorId, int enrollmentCap, java.lang.String meetingDays)
      Creates a course object without a start time and end time Course requires a name, title, section, credits, instructor ID, meeting days Start time for a course is set to 0, 0 when the course is not provided startTime and endTime
      Course​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String section, int credits, java.lang.String instructorId, int enrollmentCap, java.lang.String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      Creates course object with all possible fields a name, title, section, credits, instructor ID, meeting days, start time, end time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course​(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String section,
              int credits,
              java.lang.String instructorId,
              int enrollmentCap,
              java.lang.String meetingDays,
              int startTime,
              int endTime)
        Creates course object with all possible fields a name, title, section, credits, instructor ID, meeting days, start time, end time.
        Parameters:
        name - represents the name of a course
        title - represents the title of a course
        section - represents the section number of the course as a string
        credits - represents the total credit hours of a course
        instructorId - represents the instructor ID
        enrollmentCap - - capacity of course to hold students.
        meetingDays - represents which days the class meets on as a string (MTWHFA)
        startTime - the start time as military time
        endTime - the end time as military time

      • Course

        public Course​(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String section,
              int credits,
              java.lang.String instructorId,
              int enrollmentCap,
              java.lang.String meetingDays)
        Creates a course object without a start time and end time Course requires a name, title, section, credits, instructor ID, meeting days Start time for a course is set to 0, 0 when the course is not provided startTime and endTime
        Parameters:
        name - represents the name of a course
        title - represents the title of a course
        section - represents the section number of the course as a string
        credits - represents the total credit hours of a course
        instructorId - represents the instructor ID
        enrollmentCap - capacity of course to hold students.
        meetingDays - represents which days the class meets on as a string (MTWHFA)

      • setSection

        public void setSection​(java.lang.String section)
        Sets the section of the course. A section must be 3 digits long and only contain digits.
        Parameters:
        section - the section to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - when section length is not 3 or is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - when section is not made up of digits.

      • getCredits

        public int getCredits()
        Returns the credit value of the course.
        Returns:
        the credits

      • setCredits

        public void setCredits​(int credits)
        Sets the credit value of the course Credits must be between 1 and 5 inclusive.
        Parameters:
        credits - - The credit value of the course.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the credits is less than 1 or greater than 5.

      • getInstructorId

        public java.lang.String getInstructorId()
        Returns the instructor ID.
        Returns:
        instructorId - instructor ID of the course

      • setInstructorId

        public void setInstructorId​(java.lang.String instructorId)
        Sets the intructorID. InstructorID can not be null or an empty string.
        Parameters:
        instructorId - the instructorId to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when instructorId is null or an empty string.

      • getShortDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getShortDisplayArray()
        Returns a shortened array of course information to be used as a display in WolfScheduler includes the course name, section, title, and meeting string.
        Specified by:
        getShortDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        short version of display array

      • getLongDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getLongDisplayArray()
        Returns a long version of an array of course information used to display course information. Long display array contains the course name, section, title, credits, Instructor ID, meeting string and and empty string for an event field.
        Specified by:
        getLongDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        long array version of the display array

      • setMeetingDaysAndTime

        public void setMeetingDaysAndTime​(java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
        setMeetingDaysAndTime sets the meeting days and times for a course Meeting days is processed as a string and the times are in military format. The meeting day string must be one of the allowed characters (M T W H F A) and no repeats, otherwise invalid.
        Overrides:
        setMeetingDaysAndTime in class Activity
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - - string representing the days the course takes place
        startTime - - start time of the course in military time
        endTime - - end time of the course in military time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if meetingDays is null or an empty string
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if meetingDays contains anything other than a (M T W H F A) character
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any meetingDays characters repeat

      • getCourseRoll

        public CourseRoll getCourseRoll()
        Returns the course roll.
        Returns:
        course roll of the course.

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Course c)
        Compares two courses to find the lexicographic order by name, then section.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Course>
        Parameters:
        c - - course to compare to.
        Returns:
        1 if the current instance occurs after the parameter. 0 if the current instance matches the parameter. -1 if the current instance occurs before the parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the course is null
